publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2347 Maureen Macmillan: Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children—That the Parliament acknowledges that 2005 is the Year of the Volunteer which promotes the social and personal benefits of people giving their time for others and provides information on how they can become involved with volunteering in their local communities; notes that the Year of the Volunteer 2005 is being run across the whole of the United Kingdom and is supported by the Scottish Executive, working in partnership with a range of voluntary organisations, including CSV; further notes that February is dedicated to the theme of Youth and Children; recognises the valuable role which younger volunteers play in communities across Scotland, and pays tribute to their work for people of all ages.

S2M-2347 Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children (lodged on 1 February 2005) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Eleanor Scott*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Margaret Jamieson*, Scott Barrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Mike Pringle*, Christine May*, Rob Gibson*, Mr David Davidson*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael McMahon*, Sarah Boyack*, Robin Harper*, Rosie Kane*, Jackie Baillie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Dr Jean Turner*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Margaret Mitchell*, Chris Ballance*

S2M-2347 Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children (lodged on 1 February 2005) Mr Jamie Stone*, Robert Brown*, Elaine Smith*, Cathie Craigie*, Trish Godman*, Mary Scanlon*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Karen Whitefield*

S2M-2347 Maureen Macmillan: Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children—That the Parliament acknowledges that 2005 is the Year of the Volunteer which promotes the social and personal benefits of people giving their time for others and provides information on how they can become involved with volunteering in their local communities; notes that the Year of the Volunteer 2005 is being run across the whole of the United Kingdom and is supported by the Scottish Executive, working in partnership with a range of voluntary organisations, including CSV; further notes that February is dedicated to the theme of Youth and Children; recognises the valuable role which younger volunteers play in communities across Scotland, and pays tribute to their work for people of all ages. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Eleanor Scott, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Shiona Baird, Mrs Nanette Milne, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Scott Barrie, Marilyn Livingstone, Mike Pringle, Christine May, Rob Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Patrick Harvie, Ms Sandra White, Michael McMahon, Sarah Boyack, Robin Harper, Rosie Kane, Jackie Baillie, Tommy Sheridan, Dr Jean Turner, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Frank McAveety, Margaret Mitchell, Chris Ballance, Mr Jamie Stone, Robert Brown, Elaine Smith, Cathie Craigie, Trish Godman, Mary Scanlon, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Bill Butler*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-2347 Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children (lodged on 1 February 2005) Marlyn Glen*
S2M-2347 Year of the Volunteer 2005 - Month of Youth and Children (lodged on 1 February 2005) Donald Gorrie*
